section.docs: Messaging covers IM, SMS, & Email. All records are automatically associated by the server based on who they are sent to/from. Anyone can send messages. Messages also have attachments. They can also have todos & comments.

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `POST /emails`: All users * `POST /sms`: All users * `POST /ims`: All users * `GET /messages`: All users according to scoping * `GET /messages/:id`: All users according to scoping * `DELETE /messages/:id`: Your messages or Gods * `POST /messages/:id/read`: Your messages
### Scoping
You are granted read access to messages in the following ways:
1. You sent the message 2. The message was sent to you 3. The message was sent to a contact your following 4. You're a god

section.title: Sending Email
section.docs:
You can send an email to any address. The server will do work and connect the dots between the email addresses, users, contacts, groups and extra fields to associate the email with the correc records. This is usage based billing request.
to
Required
Array of email addresses to mail to
cc
Array of email addresses to mail cc
bcc
Array of email addresses to mail cc
subject
Subject of the email
message
Full body of the email
html
Include an HTML part
attachments_attributes
See attachments section

section.title: Sending SMS
section.docs:
You can send an SMS to any number. The server will connect the dots between the numbers, users, contacts, and groups to associate the SMS with the correct records. You must supply the phone numbers in international format. This is usage based billing request.
to
Required
Array of **internationally** formated phones numbers to deliver to
message
Required
